com.fxgraph.edges

Class AbstractEdgeGraphic

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • com.fxgraph.edges.AbstractEdgeGraphic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CorneredEdge.EdgeGraphic, CorneredLoopEdge.EdgeGraphic, DoubleCorneredEdge.EdgeGraphic, Edge.EdgeGraphic, MessageEdge.EdgeGraphic, SimpleEdge.SimpleEdgeGraphic

    public abstract class AbstractEdgeGraphic
extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
    An abstract edge graphic superclass with a group for basic edge graphics, a text label, and an arrow for showing a directed line.

    Includes methods for calculating the terminal point for an edge given the target graphic and a fallback target point.
    Author:
    sirolf2009, ogallagher (javadoc)

      • setupArrow

        protected void setupArrow(javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding sourceX,
                          javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding sourceY,
                          javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding targetX,
                          javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding targetY)
        Binds the arrow start and end points to given point components, and adds a style class to the arrow.
        Parameters:
        sourceX - Observable start x.
        sourceY - Observable start y.
        targetX - Observable end x.
        targetY - Observable end y.

      • setupArrowIntersect

        protected void setupArrowIntersect(javafx.scene.layout.Region target,
                                   javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding sourceX,
                                   javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding sourceY,
                                   javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding targetX,
                                   javafx.beans.binding.DoubleBinding targetY)
        Given a target graphic to connect with, attempt to find an edge target point to which to connect the arrow. On failure to find an edge target point, the raw target location is used.

        Ultimately calls setupArrow(DoubleBinding, DoubleBinding, DoubleBinding, DoubleBinding) using the modified target point.
        Parameters:
        target - Target graphic to connect with (typically a cell graphic).
        sourceX - Observable start x.
        sourceY - Observable start y.
        targetX - Observable end x.
        targetY - Observable end y.

      • getIntercept

        protected java.util.Optional<javafx.geometry.Point2D> getIntercept(javafx.geometry.Point2D source,
                                                                   javafx.geometry.Point2D target,
                                                                   javafx.scene.layout.Region shape)
        Given a line from source to target, find an appropriate section with the edge of the target graphic. Currently only works accurately for rectangular targets, using the bounding box. TODO extend to accurately terminate on the edge of any target shape.
        Parameters:
        source - Source point.
        target - Target point.
        shape - Target shape.
        Returns:
        Optional target edge point.

      • calculateInterceptionPoint

        private static javafx.geometry.Point2D calculateInterceptionPoint(javafx.geometry.Point2D line1Start,
                                                                  javafx.geometry.Point2D line1End,
                                                                  javafx.geometry.Point2D line2Start,
                                                                  javafx.geometry.Point2D line2End)
        Given endpoints for two straight segments, calculate an intersection point.
        Parameters:
        line1Start - First line start point.
        line1End - First line end point.
        line2Start - Second line start point.
        line2End - Second line end point.
        Returns:
        The intersection point, or null if none exist.
